senses.de: A planned meeting with somebody at a specific time and place.
senses.ex: He has an appointment with his dentist tomorrow.

Tips.title: Scheduled Interaction
Tips.description: Used for professional or formal scenarios requiring booking a time slot.
Tips.example: I have an appointment with my lawyer next week.

Tips.title: Time Specificity
Tips.description: Emphasizes the importance of time, suggesting punctuality is expected.
Tips.example: Your appointment is at 3 PM, so please arrive early.

Tips.title: Confirming Details
Tips.description: Often involves a confirmation or reminder call, email, or message.
Tips.example: The doctor's office called to confirm my appointment for Monday.

senses.de: An official job or duty that somebody is given.
senses.ex: She accepted the appointment as ambassador to France.

Tips.title: Professional Position
Tips.description: Refers to being chosen for a specific role, often within an organization.
Tips.example: He was delighted to receive the appointment as the head of marketing.

Tips.title: Formal Offer
Tips.description: Usually official and sometimes requires a formal acceptance or oath.
Tips.example: After the election, the mayor's first appointment was her chief advisor.

Tips.title: Authority Granted
Tips.description: Implies that authority or responsibility is given to someone.
Tips.example: The appointment gave her the authority to lead the project.

senses.de: The act or process of choosing someone for a job or duty.
senses.ex: The appointment of the new CEO was announced yesterday.

Tips.title: Selection Process
Tips.description: A formal decision made by a person or group in power to fill a role.
Tips.example: The appointment of the new director was made by the board of trustees.

Tips.title: Reputation Impact
Tips.description: Can affect public opinion about a company or institution.
Tips.example: The community questioned the appointment of the new police chief.

Tips.title: Official Announcement
Tips.description: Often communicated through press releases or official statements.
Tips.example: The organization's website posted an announcement about the recent appointments.

senses.de: Pieces of furniture or equipment provided for a particular use.
senses.ex: The cabin has all the necessary appointments.

Tips.title: Specific to Place
Tips.description: Refers to objects that are part of a building's set up.
Tips.example: The apartment's appointments included a washing machine and curtains.

Tips.title: Enhancement Purpose
Tips.description: Items are chosen to increase functionality or aesthetic of a space.
Tips.example: We selected new office appointments to improve the workspace.

Arrangement.wordDefinition:
An arrangement refers to a more general plan made between people, and can involve multiple options of where and when to meet.

Arrangements are often made in a more casual context, such as planning to meet up with friends or organizing a dinner party.

An appointment is a fixed schedule with a professional, while an arrangement is a more flexible agreement between people for a casual event.

Assignment.wordDefinition:
An assignment is a task or job given to someone as part of their duties or work (for example, a homework assignment or a work assignment).

An appointment is applicable when setting up a meeting with someone while an assignment is applicable when giving someone a task or job to complete.

Date.wordDefinition:
A date is a more informal meeting between two people, usually for the purpose of getting to know each other better romantically.

Dates can be pre-planned or spontaneous and may include activities, such as seeing a movie, going to a restaurant, or taking a walk.

In summary, appointments are typically professional meetings, while dates are personal meetings between two people in a romantic context.

Engagement.wordDefinition:
Engagement refers to a planned meeting or event with friends or family, often social in nature.

Both words are applicable in different contexts. Appointment is suitable for professional or formal settings, while engagement is more casual and social.

Meet.wordDefinition:
A meet is a casual term used to describe randomly meeting someone without having planned or scheduled it beforehand. It's an informal word that doesn't typically involve a specific time or place.

You could meet your friend at the mall or run into an acquaintance on the street. There's no real agenda or structure to a meet, and it's often more spontaneous.

An appointment is a formal arrangement made in advance, while a meet is an informal, unplanned encounter.

Rendezvous.wordDefinition:
Both words refer to a set time and place to meet someone, but appointment usually refers to a scheduled meeting, especially for business or professional purposes, while rendezvous is often used to describe a more informal meeting between friends or lovers.

For example, you might have an appointment with a doctor or a job interview, but you might make a rendezvous with a friend for coffee or a date with a romantic partner.

Schedule.wordDefinition:
A schedule is a plan or outline that shows what activities will take place at what times over a longer period of time, such as a day, a week, or even a month.

An appointment is a specific time set aside for a particular purpose or meeting, while a schedule is a broader plan or outline of events over a longer period of time.

Tryst.wordDefinition:
Both appointment and tryst refer to planned meetings between people, but appointment is a more formal and general term that can apply to any type of scheduled meeting, such as a doctor's appointment or a business meeting.

Tryst, on the other hand, has a specific connotation of a secret or romantic rendezvous between two people.

quotes.Text: The next time you find yourself racing quickly down the street, know that you're not only running to your next appointment, you are literally running from contact with your truest feelings, deepest needs and most valuable insights.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Karen Salmansohn

quotes.Text: My answer to those who oppose my appointment as CEO is that this is really a decision of the YWCA. They want to strengthen their grassroots to advocate on behalf of women's and children's empowerment and ending racism.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Patricia Ireland

quotes.Text: I coach soccer, and my wife and I are very involved in our kids' lives. Our family is busy with doctor appointments, soccer practice, school, work, travel, vacation... life.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Patrick Lencioni

quotes.Text: In not having an appointment at Harvard, I'm in the company of a great many people whose work I admire tremendously, in particular women of color.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Catharine MacKinnon

quotes.Text: I think the important thing about my appointment is not that I will decide cases as a woman, but that I am a woman who will get to decide cases.
quotes.Title: American Judge
quotes.Name: Sandra Day O'Connor

quotes.Text: I have a lifetime appointment and I intend to serve it. I expect to die at 110, shot by a jealous husband.
quotes.Title: American Judge
quotes.Name: Thurgood Marshall

quotes.Text: Plan your workouts in advance and try and stick to them like appointments you can't miss.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Joe Wicks

quotes.Text: On 9/11, that morning, I was in a Christian Dior Couture appointment at the Hotel Pierre.
quotes.Title: American Editor
quotes.Name: Andre Leon Talley

quotes.Text: Death and life have their determined appointments; riches and honors depend upon heaven.
quotes.Title: Chinese Philosopher
quotes.Name: Confucius

quotes.Text: Appointment viewing is dead, and I think it is going away.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: Dana Brunetti
